Based on the information you provided, it seems like you want me to check out a research article titled "Challenges and Barriers in Intercultural Communication between Patients with Immigration Backgrounds and Health Professionals: A Systematic Literature Review" authored by Xuelin Zhao and published in the journal Health Communication in 2021.

This article discusses the challenges and barriers that patients with immigrant backgrounds face in communicating with health professionals. The author conducted a systematic review of the literature and identified several factors that contribute to communication breakdowns, including language barriers, cultural differences, and lack of trust.

The author also discusses potential solutions to improve intercultural communication in healthcare settings, such as using interpreters or cultural brokers, providing cultural competency training to healthcare providers, and creating more diverse healthcare teams.

Overall, this article provides valuable insights into the complex issues surrounding intercultural communication in healthcare and highlights the importance of addressing these challenges to ensure that patients receive the best possible care.
